alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 8:50PM CST until February 19 at 9:45PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Alabama, including the following counties, southeastern Jackson and and extreme northeastern Marshall. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 846 PM CST, emergency management reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Water over the roadways was reported at the 1500 block and 2300 block in the Dutton area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Scottsboro, Sylvania, Hollywood, Powell, Section, Pisgah, Dutton, Langston, Rosalie and Lake Guntersville St Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
